definition: Soviet Communist Party/abbr. for 蘇聯共產黨|苏联共产党[Su1 lian2 Gong4 chan3 dang3]
old variant of 蘇|苏[su1]
surname Su/abbr. for Soviet Union 蘇維埃|苏维埃 or 蘇聯|苏联/abbr. for Jiangsu province 江蘇|江苏/abbr. for Suzhou city 蘇州|苏州
see 囉囌|啰苏[luo1 su1]
variant of 蘇|苏[su1]/to revive
Perilla frutescens (Chinese basil or wild red basil)/place name/to revive/used as phonetic in transliteration
common/general/to share/together/total/altogether/abbr. for 共產黨|共产党[Gong4 chan3 dang3], Communist party

sentences.english: In Nixon's tenure, the United States held three Soviet summit.
sentences.chinese: 在尼克松任期内，美苏共举行了三次首脑会晤。

sentences.english: The degeneration of the CPSU in the later period first began in the ideological field.
sentences.chinese: 苏共后期的蜕变首先是从思想领域开始的。

sentences.english: CCP commenced the disputation with CPSU on the general route of international communist movement.
sentences.chinese: 中共开始与苏共进行关于国际共运总路线的大论战。

definition: Nikita Khrushchev (1894-1971), secretary-general of Soviet Communist Party 1953-1964
Gorbachev/Mikhail Sergeyevich Gorbachev (1931-), last president of the Soviet Union 1991-1995
Joseph Stalin (1879-1953), Soviet dictator
Bolshevik
Yeltsin (name)/Boris Yeltsin (1931-2007) first post-communist president of Russia 1991-1999
Leonid Brezhnev (1906-1982), Soviet statesman, General Secretary of the Communist Party of the USSR 1966-1982
Leon Davidovich Trotsky (1879-1940), early Bolshevik leader, exiled by Stalin in 1929 and murdered in 1940
Nikolai Ivanovich Bukharin (1888-1938), Soviet revolutionary theorist, executed after a show trial in 1937
Communist International or Comintern (1919-1943), also known as the Third International 第三國際|第三国际[Di4 san1 Guo2 ji4]
Vladimir Ilyich Lenin (1870-1924), Russian revolutionary leader
Stalinism
October Revolution
Soviet Union, 1922-1991/abbr. for Union of Soviet Socialist Republics (USSR) 蘇維埃社會主義共和國聯盟|苏维埃社会主义共和国联盟[Su1 wei2 ai1 She4 hui4 zhu3 yi4 Gong4 he2 guo2 Lian2 meng2]
Le Duan (1907-1986), Vietnamese communist politician
Workers' Party (Singapore opposition party)
Supreme Soviet
